ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course has been nothing but amazing. As an international student whose first language is not English, this class has made me much more comfortable with my writing and ability to communicate through writing. The assignments are designed to improve the students writing while also letting them explore topics they're interested in. An overall great course!
I was able to learn how to write using the "They Say/ I Say" templates and how to perform close readings on papers.
I gained a deeper understanding of the inter connectedness of family and how to write using an I perspective/voice.

A greater understanding of families -- especially the roles of chosen families in one's life. 

-Close reading analysis skills
-how to organize and find academic sources 
-seminar discussion skills

I learned a lot about families while also improving my writing skills. I will walk away from this class with many new perspectives on family structures and the influence of family on other parts of life. In addition to my writing skills, my ability to analyze and discuss different writings improved through this class.

I learned that most compelling form of writing occurs when a writer creates a conversation. Writing should be fluid and and I was able to practice this skill by writing multiple drafts for each essay we were working on.
I practiced my close reading skills and improved on my clarity of argument.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Everything. Professor Coleman, the small classes, the assignments ++
The class was wonderful! The environment was very positive and Professor Coleman was very supportive.
The classroom environment is beyond collaborative. I walked out of class this semester feeling like I have found a new chosen family.

The course was very organized and engaging. Since there were many check in points for each essay, it made it easier to stay on top of the assignments. I felt like the class built on itself, which was really helpful because I worked up to writing longer papers after starting with shorter papers. I really appreciated the class conversations and group work. I was able to learn a lot from my peers in this class, in addition to our professor. The entire class was encouraged to participate during class which kept classes very interesting.

Strengths: students were able to contract for a grade. each grade had specific requirements, the higher the grade the more responsibilities and assignments that each student had. This helped to make the grading process objective.  

weaknesses: sometimes class discussions could be dry because participation wasn't the greatest but the topics that we were discussing always had substance.
A lot of strengths. Class engagement and level of interest in topics. Grading system allowed me to focus a lot more on my writing than the actual grade I got.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES!! Seriously, take this course! English 114 is a great way to start of your university experience. You get to improve your writing while never feeling overwhelmed by the workload. I would also deeply recommend taking a class with professor Coleman if you can, she is absolutely wonderful!
Yes. It helps to lay out the groundwork for academic writing that will be helpful in your future endeavors.

I would highly recommend this course to another student because the content was interesting and helpful, and the professor was excellent. The class organization and environment made for very effective teaching and learning.

Yes, Professor Coleman is an amazing teacher who has only encouraged me to develop my writing skills. This english 114 class discusses the topics of family and what makes a family. The class discussions were always enlightening and I truly feel that I learned so much about myself and my values from this class. If you can, take the class.
Yes. Take this if you have the chance
